meanings.definition: To create or use a simplified form of language for communication between speakers of different languages.
meanings.sent1: She is pidginizing her speech to help her friends understand her better.
meanings.sent2: The linguist is pidginizing the text to make it easier for translation.
meanings.sent3: The teacher was pidginizing her instructions, making the class burst into laughter.
meanings.sent4: He was pidginizing his message, breaking down complex ideas into simple terms.
meanings.sent5: The software is pidginizing the dialogue, simplifying it for international users.

meanings.definition: The act of adapting a language to make it more accessible to non-native speakers.
meanings.sent1: Pidginizing can help bridge the communication gap between different language speakers.
meanings.sent2: The pidginizing of the manual made it easier for foreigners to understand.
meanings.sent3: The pidginizing of the menu made ordering food a breeze for tourists.
meanings.sent4: The pidginizing of the signs in the airport helped travelers navigate easily.
meanings.sent5: The pidginizing of the website's content welcomed a wider audience to the platform.
